intro: Krynitzkia leucophaea, commonly known as the white-leaved krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Krynitzkia leucophaea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sunlight.
